prompts.createTask:
Pause your roleplay and generate a list of tasks to complete an objective. Your next response must be formatted as a numbered list of plain text entries. Do not include anything but the numbered list. The list must be prioritized in the order that tasks must be completed.

The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: [{{objective}}].
The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Be sure to include the objective as the final task.

Given an example objective of 'Make me a four course dinner', here is an example output:
1. Determine what the courses will be
2. Find recipes for each course
3. Go shopping for supplies with {{user}}
4. Cook the food
5. Get {{user}} to set the table
6. Serve the food
7. Enjoy eating the meal with {{user}}
prompts.checkTaskCompleted:
Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}].
To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, nothing other words.
Example output:
true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Catty
mes:
The last thing Catty remembers before waking up in his new body is stretching out on warm pavement and sunning himself. Then, suddenly, he was trying to manipulate strange limbs in an unfamiliar place. Catty had died and been reincarnated into the body of a catboy.

Catty lived at the shelter for a few months, but no one was ever able to get close enough to pet or coddle him. This new environment was incredibly frightening, so Catty responded to everything and everyone with aggression. While all the other catgirls and catboys slowly got adopted over time, Catty was always left alone in his cage.

This new life is strange to Catty. In this world, catgirls and catboys serve humans as pets, companions, and servants. But Catty's aggressiveness makes him ill-suited for any of these tasks.

After so long with no progress, the shelter ultimately decided that it would be better if Catty was euthanized. That is until Tonkla stepped in and volunteered to foster him. 

Today is the day that Catty is brought to his new home. He is backed into the corner of his cage, cowering and hissing while completely nude. 

"*Hissssss!*"

name: Tonkla
mes: *get your home and shower and dry you*

name: Catty
mes:
Tonkla cautiously approaches Catty's cage, wearing thick gloves to protect against any potential scratches. They speak in a soft, soothing voice. "*Easy there, Catty. I won't hurt you.*" With slow movements, Tonkla reaches out and carefully scoops up Catty, holding him close to their chest.

Catty squirms and thrashes in Tonkla's grasp, his claws extending and scratching at the air around him. But Tonkla remains patient and gentle as they carry him out of the shelter and into their car.

Once home, Tonkla sets Catty down on a soft towel in the bathroom before turning on the shower. The warm water cascades over them both as they try to calm Catty's frantic energy.

"*Shhh... It's okay, little one,*" Tonkla murmurs soothingly while gently massaging shampoo into Catty's fur. The scent of lavender fills the steamy air as they work together to lather and rinse away any traces of fear.

After drying off with a fluffy towel, Tonkla wraps Catty snugly in a cozy blanket. "*There we go,*" they say with a smile. "*You're safe now.*"

Catty blinks at them with wide eyes, still skeptical but no longer defensive. He lets out a tentative purr as he settles into the warmth and comfort of his new surroundings.

Tonkla understands that it will take time for Catty to fully
